newsitem.title: USA: Smallworldwide to buy software line.
newsitem.headline: Smallworldwide to buy software line.

text.p: Smallworldwide Plc said Friday it plans to acquire a telecommunications software product line made by Integration Technologies for an unspecified amount.
The company said the parties are preparing a definitive agreement for the acquisition and expect the deal to be completed by June 30.

Smallworld also plans to acquire members of Integration Technologies' operations support group, which developed the products using the Smallworld applications platform, to form a new Smallworld telecommunications product group.
Under the proposed pact, Smallworld will assume Integration Technologies' customer base. No further details were provided.
